Key Match Events: The match was abandoned due to rain.
Michael Jones and George Munsey took Scotland to 90 without loss.
England were set an adjusted target of 109.
Mark Wood over-stepped, resulting in a no-ball, and George Munsey survived on 16.
Jofra Archer's first over in international cricket in Barbados was bowled.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland win the toss and bat first.
Jos Buttler, England's captain, reckons he would have bowled first anyhow.
He's 'delighted' to have Jofra Archer back in his arsenal from injury.
England are highlighting some pretty impressive form from Phil Salt too.
Scotland are here to play, having progressed undefeated through the Europe Region Qualifier.
Post-Match Reflections: Credit to Scotland's Michael Jones and George Munsey, who took their side to 90 without loss.
It was a shame that the match was abandoned due to rain, as it would have been intriguing to watch England have a go at chasing 109.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The rain has stopped in Bridgetown, but the match was still abandoned.
There's 90 minutes of extra time for morning matches.
England have played 16 T20s in the Caribbean since 2014, more than any other full member nation.
The last time England and Scotland met in an ODI, Scotland won by six runs.
